title: Phase 1.2: Create UnusedIntermediateVarRemovalTransforms - remove raw_params_*, this1, result vars
description:
## Problem
Variables like raw_params_title, broadcast_result, this1, result are generated but never used.
This produces ~12+ Elixir compiler warnings about unused variables.

## Root Cause
AST builders generate scaffolding variables that aren't cleaned up:
- FunctionBuilder generates this1 for return value tracking
- EctoQueryBuilder generates intermediate query vars
- Other builders generate temp vars for complex expressions

## Solution
Create a FINAL pass that removes all unused intermediate variables by:
1. Collecting all variable assignments in module
2. Checking if each is used (via VarUseAnalyzer)
3. Removing unused assignments entirely (not just underscore prefixing)

Key insight: Remove the assignment entirely rather than underscore-prefixing.
```elixir
# Before
raw_params_title = params["title"]  # unused, generates warning
# After  
# (line removed entirely)
```

## Files to Modify
- src/reflaxe/elixir/ast/builders/FunctionBuilder.hx - Avoid this1 generation where possible
- src/reflaxe/elixir/ast/transformers/EctoQueryIIFEInlineTransforms.hx - Inline scaffolding
- NEW: src/reflaxe/elixir/ast/transformers/UnusedIntermediateVarRemovalTransforms.hx

## Dependencies
- Depends on: Phase 1.1 (VarUseAnalyzer consolidation for reliable usage detection)

## Acceptance Criteria
- No unused intermediate variable warnings in todo-app
- raw_params_* variables either used or removed
- broadcast_result variables either used or removed
- npm test passes
- mix compile --force shows reduced warnings

## Effort: 4-6 hours | Impact: Fixes 12+ warnings
notes: Reopened (was closed by mistake; pending work + verification).

comments.author: fullofcaffeine
comments.text:
Verified no remaining intermediate-temp warnings:
- rg -n "raw_params_|broadcast_result|\bthis1\b" examples returned 0.
- Todo-app QA sentinel compiles with mix compile --warnings-as-errors (WAE gate) successfully.
- Snapshot suite remains green after recent hygiene cleanups.
Conclusion: intermediate-temp cleanup already achieved via existing late passes (DropTempNilAssign, EFnTempChainSimplify, etc.) + WAE gating.

title: Enforce __elixir__/extern boundary rules
description: Add compile-time checks to ban app-level __elixir__ injections and externs except whitelisted boundary modules; fail build on violations; update docs.
notes: Reopened (was closed by mistake; pending work + verification).

comments.author: fullofcaffeine
comments.text:
Implemented compile-time boundary enforcement for example apps:

- Added `reflaxe.elixir.macros.BoundaryEnforcer` (macro phase, `Context.onAfterTyping`) to fail builds if example app sources use `__elixir__()` injections or ad-hoc `extern class` escape hatches.
- Wired into `reflaxe.elixir.CompilerInit.Start()` so it runs automatically for Elixir builds.
- Allowed `@:gettext` in `ElixirCompiler.hasSpecialAnnotations()` to keep annotation-driven Gettext generation consistent with other boundary modules.
- Todo-app cleanup: removed dead i18n extern glue (`server.infrastructure.Gettext*`, `TranslationBindings`) and an unused `TodoLiveNative` extern; updated `build-server.hxml` (and legacy hxml) to stop referencing removed modules.
- Docs: clarified `__elixir__()` is intended for std/framework code only, not apps.

Verification:
- `npm test`
- `npm run ci:guards`
- `npm run test:examples`
- QA sentinel (async): `scripts/qa-sentinel.sh --app examples/todo-app --env e2e --port 4001 --playwright --e2e-spec 'e2e/*.spec.ts' --async --deadline 900 --verbose` (RUN_ID=1766614036, status=0)

comments.text:

- Boundary enforcement is now opt-in via `-D reflaxe_elixir_strict_examples` so user projects are not restricted from using `__elixir__()` or ad-hoc externs.
- All repo examples enable the define in their `.hxml` files to keep examples “pure Haxe -> Elixir”.
- Updated injection guide to clarify this is a repository policy, not a compiler limitation.

title: PERF: Replace O(n²) hygiene passes with O(n) single-pass implementations
description:
## Problem
Multiple AST transformation passes use O(n²) algorithms where for each statement, they walk all remaining statements to check variable usage. This causes builds to take 2+ hours for large files like TodoLive.hx (1407 lines).

## Current State
- fast_boot flag added to bypass slow passes (commit 28dfed65)
- Build time reduced from 2+ hours to 5.4 seconds
- Trade-off: Some unused variable warnings in generated Elixir

## Solution
Replace O(n²) per-statement checks with O(n) single-pass collection:
1. Create OptimizedVarUseAnalyzer with single-pass usage collection
2. Update each slow pass to use the new analyzer
3. Remove fast_boot guards once optimized

## Affected Passes (VarUseAnalyzer or usedLater pattern)
- UnusedLocalAssignUnderscoreFinalTransforms
- DefParamUnusedUnderscoreTransforms (3 instances)
- LocalAssignUnusedUnderscoreScopedTransforms
- FinalUnderscoreRepairTransforms
- LocalUnderscoreBinderPromoteTransforms
- CasePatternUnusedUnderscoreTransforms
- AssignmentChainCleanupTransforms
- ControllerLocalAssignUnusedUnderscoreTransforms
- TopLevelNilAssignDiscardTransforms
- FunctionParamUnusedUnderscoreFinalTransforms
- CaseClauseUnusedBinderUnderscoreFinalTransforms

## Success Criteria
- All tests pass without fast_boot flag
- Build completes in <30 seconds for todo-app
- Zero Elixir warnings for unused variables
notes: Reopened (was closed by mistake; pending work + verification).

comments.author: fullofcaffeine
comments.text:
Plan (perf hygiene O(n) sweep):
1) Identify enabled passes still doing O(n^2) usedLater scans over statement lists.
2) Migrate them to OptimizedVarUseAnalyzer suffix indices (build/buildExact as appropriate) + any needed declaration suffix indices.
3) Remove fast_boot guards for passes proven O(n) (fast_boot stays opt-in, but shouldn't skip optimized passes).
4) Verify: npm run ci:guards, npm test, npm run test:examples; ensure todo-app builds fast without fast_boot.
5) Close per-pass bd tasks (starting with haxe.elixir-c5h) and keep haxe.elixir-61r updated until all listed passes are migrated.

Fixed correctness gaps in the analyzer (EParen traversal + bitstring-aware tokenization so var::utf8 patterns keep the var token). Verified: npm run ci:guards, npm test, and todo-app QA sentinel (async) all pass; Haxe server build now completes in ~5s with zero WAE warnings.

title: Phase 1.3: Create FinalUnderscorePrefixTransforms - move ALL underscore prefixing to final pass
description:
## Problem
`_this` is used after being set, which Elixir warns about:
```
warning: variable "_this" is unused (if the variable is not meant to be used, prefix it with an underscore)
```

The variable has underscore prefix but is still being used later in the code.

## Root Cause
Underscore prefix is applied in builders (too early), but usage is detected in transforms (too late).

Timeline problem:
1. Builder creates `_this` with underscore (assuming unused)
2. Later code uses `_this` 
3. Transform runs but underscore already applied
4. Elixir sees underscore-prefixed var being used = warning

## Solution
Move ALL underscore prefixing to a FINAL sentinel pass that runs after all other transforms.

## Files to Modify
- src/reflaxe/elixir/ast/builders/*.hx - Remove early underscore prefixing
- UPDATE: src/reflaxe/elixir/ast/transformers/FinalUnderscorePrefixTransforms.hx (may exist)

## Implementation
1. Remove underscore logic from all builders
2. Create/update final pass that:
   - Scans entire module for ALL variable definitions
   - Collects ALL variable usages across entire module
   - Only THEN applies underscore prefix to truly unused variables
3. Register as LAST pass in transformation pipeline

## Key Principle
Underscore prefix decision must happen AFTER all transformations that might add/remove usages.

## Dependencies
- Should run after: Phase 1.0A (this1 cleanup)
- Blocks: Phase 1.2 (removal pass needs correct usage data)

## Acceptance Criteria
- No "underscore variable used after set" warnings
- All truly unused variables get underscore prefix
- All used variables do NOT get underscore prefix
- npm test passes
- mix compile --force shows no underscore-usage warnings

## Effort: 2-3 hours | Impact: Fixes 2 warnings + prevents future issues
notes: Duplicate/outdated: Phase 1.3 underscore-prefixing work was already completed (see haxe.elixir-2co). Closing to keep backlog accurate.

title: fast_boot: reduce need by bounding expensive passes
description: Identify the slowest macro/transform passes in large Phoenix modules, make them algorithmically bounded, and reduce the amount of hygiene gating required under fast_boot without regressing UX.

comments.author: fullofcaffeine
comments.text: Discovery is currently broken: RepoDiscovery collects type paths but never calls Context.getType, and ElixirCompiler.filterTypes returns early without appending discovered modules. This means unreferenced @:repo/@:presence/@:endpoint/@:router/@:phoenixWeb modules may never be typed/emitted.\n\nPlan: rewrite RepoDiscovery to scan project classpaths for .hx files containing relevant metadata tokens, parse Haxe package+class, call Context.getType(haxePath) to force typing, and keep RepoEnumerator @:keep so DCE cannot drop them. Update comments in CompilerInit/ElixirCompiler to reflect the new behavior and add regression coverage (snapshot or small fixture) to ensure an unreferenced @:repo extern still emits a Repo module.

comments.author: fullofcaffeine
comments.text:
Done: fast_boot no longer skips correctness-critical module discovery/keeping.

- Added AnnotatedModuleEnumerator to mark framework-annotated modules (e.g. @:repo, @:presence, @:endpoint, @:router, @:supervisor, etc.) as @:keep/@:used so Haxe DCE can’t drop them when referenced only indirectly (supervision trees / ModuleRef("...")).
- Updated CompilerInit.Start() to always enable discovery + keep macros; RepoDiscovery now uses a temp-file cache under fast_boot to avoid repeated project-wide scans.
- Added snapshot coverage: test/snapshot/phoenix/presence_discovery (unreferenced @:presence module must still be emitted under -dce full).
- Removed now-unnecessary app-level @:keep from todo-app Presence (examples/todo-app/src_haxe/server/presence/TodoPresence.hx).

Verification:

- cd examples/todo-app && MIX_ENV=test mix test

Migrated additional late hygiene passes off O(n²) scans:

- DowncaseInlineFromPriorAssign uses indexed usedLater

comments.author: fullofcaffeine

Migrated remaining O(n²) hygiene passes to use OptimizedVarUseAnalyzer (O(n) build + O(1) checks):

- DefParamUnusedUnderscoreTransforms: build body + guard usage index once per def/defp; reuse for each param; removed legacy unused helpers.
- CasePatternUnusedUnderscoreTransforms: build usage index once per case/with clause; reuse for each binder.
- FunctionParamUnusedUnderscoreFinalTransforms: build body usage index once per def/defp; reuse for each param.
- CaseClauseUnusedBinderUnderscoreFinalTransforms: build a single usage index over clause guard + body; underscore unused binders (also handles PAlias / PBinary).

title: Compiler architecture audit vs Reflaxe reference compilers
description: Review the current AST pipeline (ElixirASTBuilder/Transformer/Printer, CompilerInit gating, GenericCompiler usage) against reference implementations under haxe.elixir.reference/. Remove legacy/dead paths and document any intentional deviations.
design:
Audit summary (2025-12-14):

- Verified compilation is GenericCompiler<ElixirAST> + ElixirOutputIterator (AST -> transforms -> ElixirASTPrinter). No alternate string-codegen pipeline is wired.
- Removed dead/legacy compatibility code: QueryCompiler.hx, ExUnitBuilder.hx, and unused macros/HXXMacro.hx.
- Removed elixir.feature.legacy flag handling (feature flags remain for specific toggles + experimental).
- Target-conditional stdlib gating in CompilerInit.Start() matches mature Reflaxe target pattern (only inject staged std/_std when compiling to elixir / -D elixir_output).

Intentional deviations / remaining non-ideal areas:
- A small number of late AST passes still do string inspection for ERaw/~H bridge cases (e.g., HeexAssignsTypeLinter, Reduce* ERaw canonicalization). These are transitional and should eventually be replaced by fully-structural AST transforms once ERaw coverage is eliminated upstream.
acceptance_criteria:
- No legacy string-based codegen paths remain reachable
- AST passes are ordered/single-purpose and documented (WHAT/WHY/HOW/EXAMPLES)
- Deviations from reference Reflaxe patterns are documented with rationale

comments.author: fullofcaffeine
comments.text: Removed unused AST builder migration scaffolding (BuilderFacade/BuilderRegistry/PatternMatchBuilder.disabled), pruned BuildContext surface (removed unused getModuleName/getFunctionName), and updated docs (moved modularization PRDs to docs/09-history). Next: compare remaining pipeline init + GenericCompiler wiring against haxe.elixir.reference/ and document intentional deviations.

comments.author: fullofcaffeine
comments.text:
Public release cleanup plan (post-1.0)

1) Release baseline
- Confirm existing tags: v1.0.0 / v1.0.1 / v1.0.2 and keep cleanup work on new commits.

2) Compiler architecture + dead code
- Purge dead/stub analysis code (unused collectors/analyzers, legacy helpers).
- Remove any placeholder output generation (e.g. EString("# TODO"), ERaw("# ERROR")); on failure emit Context.error and fall back to correct-but-less-idiomatic output.
- Audit Builder→Transformer→Printer boundaries vs reflaxe.CSharp / reflaxe.CPP and document intentional deviations.

3) Docs / markdown triage
- Inventory tracked *.md; keep current docs/01..07 as canonical.
- Move historical/investigation/roadmap material under docs/09-history/ with an index.
- Ensure README + docs links resolve after moves.

4) Verification (bounded / non-blocking)
- Snapshot suite: make -C test summary (+ negative suite if relevant).
- Todo-app runtime: scripts/qa-sentinel.sh --app examples/todo-app --port 4001 --async --deadline 300 -v

5) Finish
- Commit cleanup in focused commits; update beads statuses; ensure no new regressions.

title: Fix Phoenix infrastructure module generation - @:application, @:endpoint, @:router, @:phoenixWebModule not generating proper modules
description:
## Problem
Phoenix infrastructure modules are not being generated despite having transformation passes defined. Currently requires hand-written workaround files.

## Root Cause
1. Missing isPhoenixWeb metadata flag in compileClassImpl
2. Missing shouldGenerateClass checks for @:endpoint, @:router, @:phoenixWebModule
3. Missing output path handling for these annotations

## Implementation Plan
- Phase 1: Add isPhoenixWeb metadata flag (ElixirCompiler.hx:2357)
- Phase 2: Add shouldGenerateClass checks (ElixirCompiler.hx:426)
- Phase 3: Add output path handling in setFrameworkAwareOutputPath()
- Phase 4: Verify transformation passes work
- Phase 5: Remove workaround files and test

## Files to Modify
- src/reflaxe/elixir/ElixirCompiler.hx
- src/reflaxe/elixir/ast/transformers/AnnotationTransforms.hx

## Validation
- _GeneratedFiles.json includes all infrastructure modules
- mix compile --force && mix phx.server works without workarounds

title: Phase 1.0B: Architectural fix in TypedQueryLambda.hx - eliminate this1 at macro source
description:
## Problem
TypedQuery macros generate ERaw nodes via `__elixir__()` which contain `this1` sentinel patterns that AST transforms cannot see or clean up.

## Root Cause
TypedQueryLambda.hx line 35:
```haxe
macro new ecto.TypedQuery.TypedQuery(untyped __elixir__($v{code}, $ethis, $right));
```

This generates code like:
```elixir
(fn ->
  this1 = nil
  this1 = Ecto.Query.from(t in Todo, [])
  this1
end).()
```

The `this1` is Haxe's internal pattern for abstract method chaining return values.

## Solution: Generate Structured AST
Instead of `__elixir__()` -> ERaw, TypedQuery should generate structured AST:

Option 1: Use ERemoteCall instead of __elixir__()
```haxe
return ERemoteCall(EAtom("Ecto.Query"), "where", [
    buildQueryAst(thisExpr),
    lambdaBinding,
    buildConditionAst(right)
]);
```

Option 2: Restructure to avoid this1 entirely
Generate: Ecto.Query.where(query, [t], condition) without intermediate this1 sentinel

## Files to Modify
- src/reflaxe/elixir/macros/TypedQueryLambda.hx - Restructure macro to avoid this1

## Dependencies
- Depends on: Phase 1.0A (string cleanup provides immediate relief while this is developed)
- Blocks: Final 1.0 release (this is the proper long-term solution)

## Acceptance Criteria
- TypedQuery.where() generates clean Ecto.Query.where() calls
- No this1 pattern in generated TypedQuery code
- EFnTempChainSimplifyTransforms can see and process all query AST
- npm test passes
- All existing TypedQuery tests continue to work

## Effort: 4-6 hours | Impact: Eliminates root cause, prevents future this1 issues
notes: Reopened (was closed by mistake; pending work + verification).

comments.author: fullofcaffeine

title: Fix unused pattern match parameters (type, message, reason, value)
description:
Fix unused parameters in pattern match clauses by underscore prefixing:
- type (1x): Unused in switch case
- message (1x): Unused error message parameter  
- reason (1x): Unused error reason parameter
- value (6x simple): Unused pattern match bindings

title: BLOCKER: Fix undefined variable compilation errors in todo-app
description:
## PARTIALLY FIXED - Still 7 undefined variable errors

**Progress (2025-12-05 commit ad979f1c)**:
✅ FIXED: CasePatternUnusedUnderscoreTransforms now uses VarUseAnalyzer
✅ FIXED: CaseClauseUnusedBinderUnderscoreFinalTransforms now uses VarUseAnalyzer
- This fixed pattern match variables in case clauses

**Remaining Errors (mix compile --force)**:

### Function Parameter Issues (DIFFERENT ROOT CAUSE)
1. `raw_due` - 5 occurrences
   - Line 48: `_raw_due = Map.get(params, "due_date")` ← underscore added
   - Lines 56, 57, 61, 63: Uses `raw_due` (without underscore) ← body references original name
   
2. `user_id` - 1 occurrence
   - Line 140: `defp load_todos(_user_id)` ← underscore added to param
   - Line 145: Uses `user_id` (without underscore) ← body references original name
   
3. `sort_by` - 1 occurrence
   - Line 645: `def filter_and_sort_todos(todos, filter, _sort_by, ...)` ← underscore added
   - Line 646: Uses `sort_by` (without underscore) ← body references original name

## Root Cause Analysis
The remaining issues are NOT case pattern issues (which were fixed).
These are **function parameter underscore issues** - different transforms:

- FunctionParamUnusedUnderscoreFinalTransforms.hx - for function params
- DefParamUnusedUnderscoreTransforms.hx - for defp function definitions

These transforms need to be migrated to VarUseAnalyzer (same fix as case patterns).

## Files to Fix (Phase 2)
- src/reflaxe/elixir/ast/transformers/FunctionParamUnusedUnderscoreFinalTransforms.hx
- src/reflaxe/elixir/ast/transformers/DefParamUnusedUnderscoreTransforms.hx

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] mix compile --force has ZERO errors
- [ ] All 7 remaining undefined variable errors resolved
- [ ] npm test passes
- [ ] Application compiles and starts
notes: Resolved undefined variable compile errors in todo_app handle_event (sort_by/value) via forced sort_by binding pass. Sentinel run 1765303544 succeeded through boot/GET /. Remaining work: warning cleanup and __elixir__/extern purge.

title: Phase 1.1: Consolidate VarUseAnalyzer - centralize all variable usage detection
description:
## Problem
20+ transformer passes re-implement variable usage detection inconsistently:
- Each pass has its own collectUsedNames() implementation
- Logic varies between passes leading to inconsistent behavior
- Duplicated code increases maintenance burden
- Bugs fixed in one place don't propagate to others

## Current State
VarUseAnalyzer exists at src/reflaxe/elixir/ast/analyzers/VarUseAnalyzer.hx and is now being used.

## Progress (2025-12-05)
✅ MIGRATED: CasePatternUnusedUnderscoreTransforms - now uses VarUseAnalyzer.stmtUsesVar()
✅ MIGRATED: CaseClauseUnusedBinderUnderscoreFinalTransforms - now uses VarUseAnalyzer.stmtUsesVar()

This migration FIXED the blocker haxe.elixir-lfq (undefined variable errors in todo-app).
Commit: ad979f1c

## Remaining Files to Migrate
- src/reflaxe/elixir/ast/transformers/DefParamUnusedUnderscoreTransforms.hx
- src/reflaxe/elixir/ast/transformers/LocalAssignUnusedUnderscoreTransforms.hx  
- src/reflaxe/elixir/ast/transformers/ClauseUnusedBinderUnderscoreTransforms.hx
- src/reflaxe/elixir/ast/transformers/FunctionParamUnusedUnderscoreFinalTransforms.hx
- src/reflaxe/elixir/ast/transformers/UnusedLocalAssignUnderscoreFinalTransforms.hx
- Any other transforms with collectUsedNames() or similar logic

## Action Required
1. Audit remaining transforms for variable usage detection logic
2. Migrate each to use VarUseAnalyzer.stmtUsesVar()
3. Remove duplicated collectUsedNames() implementations
4. Ensure consistent behavior across all passes

## Dependencies
- Blocks: Phase 1.2 (intermediate var removal needs consistent usage detection)

## Acceptance Criteria
- All variable usage detection goes through VarUseAnalyzer
- No duplicate collectUsedNames() implementations remain
- npm test passes
- Same behavior maintained (no regressions)

## Effort: 2-3 hours remaining | Impact: Architectural improvement enabling better hygiene passes
notes: Reopened (was closed by mistake; pending work + verification).

title: Phase 1.0A: this1 string-level cleanup in ElixirASTPrinter.hx
description:
## Problem
Generated Elixir code contains unused `this1` variable warnings in 3 files:
- todo_live.ex (load_todos function)
- user_changeset.ex
- user_controller.ex

## Root Cause Analysis (Investigation Complete)
1. TypedQuery macros use `__elixir__()` for query generation
2. `__elixir__()` creates ERaw nodes - opaque strings in AST
3. Haxe generates `this1` sentinel for abstract method chaining: `var this1 = nil; this1 = expr; this1`
4. AST transforms can't see inside ERaw - EFnTempChainSimplifyTransforms is blind to it
5. When ERaw is multi-line, `sanitizeArgPrinted()` wraps in string-level IIFE
6. Cleanup passes already ran on AST, so they never see these string-level IIFEs

## Example of Problematic Generated Code
```elixir
defp load_todos(_user_id) do
    TodoApp.Repo.all((fn ->
      query = Ecto.Query.where((fn -> query = Ecto.Query.from(t in TodoApp.Todo, [])
      this1 = nil      # <-- WARNING: unused
      this1 = query
      this1 end).(), [t], t.user_id == ^(user_id))
      this1 = nil      # <-- WARNING: unused
      this1 = query
      this1
    end).())
end
```

## Solution: String-Level Cleanup (Quick Win)
Add post-processing cleanup in ElixirASTPrinter.hx after IIFE wrapping.

## Files to Modify
- src/reflaxe/elixir/ast/ElixirASTPrinter.hx - Add string cleanup in sanitizeArgPrinted() or new helper

## Acceptance Criteria
- No this1 warnings in todo_live.ex, user_changeset.ex, user_controller.ex
- npm test passes
- mix compile --force shows no this1 warnings

## Effort: 2-3 hours | Impact: Fixes ~6 warnings immediately
notes: Reopened (was closed by mistake; pending work + verification).

comments.author: fullofcaffeine
comments.text:
No remaining this1 warnings observed.
- rg -n \bthis1\b examples/todo-app/lib returned 0 results.
- QA sentinel now compiles todo-app with --warnings-as-errors and passes (RUN_ID=1766842283).

title: Fix unused variable warnings - add underscore prefix in compiler
description: COMPILER ENHANCEMENT: The compiler generates ~50+ unused variable warnings in Elixir. Variables like 'value', 'this1', 'e', 'o', 'c', 't', 'args', 'cl', 'constr', 'index' are declared but never used. Elixir convention requires prefixing unused variables with underscore (_value, _this1, etc). Fix in code generator to detect unused variables and add underscore prefix automatically. This is a systematic fix, not per-variable.

title: Semantics hardening: audit 'Known Limitations' and add regression coverage

title: Remove fast_boot flag and verify full performance
description:
## Goal
Final verification after all O(n) migrations complete.

## Steps
1. Remove -D fast_boot from examples/todo-app/build-server.hxml
2. Run full build and verify <30s completion
3. Run mix compile - verify zero errors
4. Run npm test - verify all tests pass
5. Document final performance numbers

## Success Criteria
- Build time <30s without fast_boot
- Zero Elixir unused variable warnings
- 100% test pass rate
- Performance documented in commit message
notes: Verified 2025-12-17: todo-app build-server.hxml no longer uses fast_boot; QA sentinel RUN_ID=1766024580 completed (Haxe build 1s, mix compile OK). Test suite passes via npm test and make -C test summary. Closing as done.
